verses.name: Proverbs 3:1
verses.text: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

verses.name: Proverbs 3:2
verses.text: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:3
verses.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

verses.name: Proverbs 3:4
verses.text: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:5
verses.text: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:6
verses.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:7
verses.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the Lord, and depart from evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:8
verses.text: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:9
verses.text: Honour the Lord with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

verses.name: Proverbs 3:10
verses.text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:11
verses.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the Lord; neither be weary of his correction:

verses.name: Proverbs 3:12
verses.text: For whom the Lord loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:13
verses.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:14
verses.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:15
verses.text: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:16
verses.text: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:17
verses.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:18
verses.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:19
verses.text: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:20
verses.text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:21
verses.text: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

verses.name: Proverbs 3:22
verses.text: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:23
verses.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:24
verses.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:25
verses.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:26
verses.text: For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:27
verses.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:28
verses.text: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:29
verses.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:30
verses.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:31
verses.text: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:32
verses.text: For the froward is abomination to the Lord: but his secret is with the righteous.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:33
verses.text: The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:34
verses.text: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

verses.name: Proverbs 3:35
verses.text: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
